<−30 °C (35& soln.) BoilingPtC = 108.5 Boiling_notes = decomp | Solubility = miscible RefractIndex = 1.3465 }} | Section3 = {{Chembox Structure MolShape = Octahedral | SiF62− }} | Section7 = {{Chembox Hazards NFPA-H = 3 NFPA-F = 0 NFPA-R = 0 NFPA-O = | ExternalMSDS = | [http://ptcl.chem.ox.ac.uk/MSDS/DI/dihydrogen_hexafluorosilicate.html External | MSDS] EUIndex = 009-011-00-5 EUClass = - Toxic
- Corrosive RPhrases = , | SPhrases = , , , FlashPt = Non-flammable LD50 = 430 mg/kg (oral, rat) }} | Section8 = {{Chembox Related OtherCations = Ammonium hexafluorosilicate
Sodium fluorosilicate | OtherCpds = Hexafluorophosphoric acid
Fluoroboric acid}} }} 'Hexafluorosilicic acid' is the inorganic compound with the formula (H3O)2SiF6; it is commonly used as a source of fluoride for water fluoridation. www.cdc.gov - Water Fluoridation Additives - Engineering Fact Sheet - Community Water Fluoridation -Oral Health [http://www.cdc.gov/fluoridation/fact_sheets/engineering/wfadditives.htm hydrofluorosilic acid]. The New Zealand Institute of Chemistry (NZIC) - Hydrofluorosilic acid and water fluoridation [http://nzic.org.nz/ChemProcesses/production/1C.pdf hydrofluorosilic acid].
